Comments_List: Taking Professor Gonzlez-Echevarras Borges Effect class enabled me to acquire comprehensive, intertextual and interdisciplinary knowledge and understanding about this important Argentine author, whose, precisely, effect upon literature itself is innumerable and immense.

The diversity of the Borgean works read and analyzed in class-from Borges y yo to El Aleph-as well as works by other authors that preceded and succeeded, affected and were influenced by these works, showcased the great variety and development within Borgean works-perhaps as its own literary genre. At the same time, the literary works discussed in this class indicated not only the fundamental characteristics shared amongst these Borgean works but also their intertextual influences and interactions with other authors works.

Yes, I would most definitely recommend this course to my colleagues, since they would be able to acquire a unique, interdisciplinary and intercultural understanding about Borgean works and the works that succeeded-and preceded-them.
